Key Match Events: Sam Hilliard tied the score with a two-run homer in the ninth inning.
Brenton Doyle delivered a game-winning single in the 10th inning.
Michael Toglia homered, Charlie Blackmon had three hits, and Cody Bellinger and Pete Crow-Armstrong each hit solo home runs.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs were six games behind the Braves and Mets for the NL wild card.
The Rockies were aiming for their second consecutive win against the Cubs.
Post-Match Reflections: Rockies players and manager expressed pride in the team's resilience.
The victory was seen as a pivotal moment in the Rockies' playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Coors Field with 47,493 attendees.
Justin Steele was close to rejoining the Cubs' rotation, and Antonio Senzatela was rehabilitating for the Rockies.
